Documents/Programming/CategoriesObjC/NSError+Easy.h

00001 #import <Cocoa/Cocoa.h>
00002 
00003 // Macros for making NSErrors
00004 
00005 /*
00006  Quick macros to make a simple error without much thinking
00007  First argument is int, second is NSString*.
00008  */
00009 #define SSYMakeError(_code,_localizedDetails) [NSError errorWithLocalizedDetails:_localizedDetails code:_code sender:nil selector:NULL]
00010 #define SSYMakeHTTPError(_code) [NSError errorWithHTTPStatusCode:_code sender:nil selector:NULL]
00011 
00012 /*
00013  Adds sender class and method name to the localized description,
00014  as described in errorWithLocalizedDetails:code:sender:selector below.
00015  This is good for errors which are not often expected; if you have a 
00016  "Copy to Clipboard" button or "Email this error to Support"
00017  on your alert users may copy and send it to your support email.
00018  This macro will only compile within an Objective-C method because
00019  it needs the local variables _cmd and self.
00020  First argument is int, second is NSString*.
00021 */ 
00022 #define SSYMakeGeekyError(_code,_localizedDetails) [NSError errorWithLocalizedDetails:_localizedDetails code:_code sender:self selector:_cmd]
00023 #define SSYMakeGeekyHTTPError(_code) [NSError errorWithHTTPStatusCode:_code sender:self selector:_cmd]
00024 
00025 // Macros for initializing and assigning an NSError** named error_p
00026 
00027 /*
00028  These are useful within functions that get an argument (NSError**)error_p
00029  Use SSYInitErrorP to assign it to *error_p to nil at beginning of function.
00030  (This is optional.  Apple doesn't do it in their methods that take NSError**,
00031  but I don't like the idea of leaving it unassigned.)
00032  Then, use the other three to assign to *error_p if/when an error occurs.
00033  Benefit: All of these macros check that error_p != NULL before assigning.
00034 */
00035 #define SSYAssignErrorP(_error) if (error_p != NULL) {*error_p = _error ;}
00036 #define SSYInitErrorP SSYAssignErrorP(nil) ;
00037 #define SSYMakeAssignErrorP(_code,_localizedDetails) SSYAssignErrorP(SSYMakeError(_code,_localizedDetails))
00038 #define SSYMakeAssignGeekyErrorP(_code,_localizedDetails) SSYAssignErrorP(SSYMakeGeekyError(_code,_localizedDetails))
00039 
00040 
00041 
00042 @interface NSError (Easy) 
00043 
00044 /*
00045  If sender != nil, will add the following line to localized description:
00046      "   Object Class: <name of sender's class>"
00047  If selector != nil, will add the following line to localized description:
00048      "   Method: <name of method>"
00049  */ 
00050 + (NSError*)errorWithLocalizedDetails:(NSString*)localizedDetails
00051                                                                  code:(int)code
00052                                                            sender:(id)sender 
00053                                                          selector:(SEL)selector ;
00054 
00055 /*
00056  If sender != nil, will add the following line to localized description:
00057  "   Object Class: <name of sender's class>"
00058  If selector != nil, will add the following line to localized description:
00059  "   Method: <name of method>"
00060  */ 
00061 + (NSError*)errorWithHTTPStatusCode:(int)code
00062                                                          sender:(id)sender 
00063                                                    selector:(SEL)selector ;
00064 
00065 /*
00066  Some methods for adding userInfo keys to errors already created
00067  */ 
00073 - (NSError*)errorByAddingLocalizedFailureReason:(NSString*)newText ;
00074 
00080 - (NSError*)errorByAddingLocalizedRecoverySuggestion:(NSString*)newText ;
00081 
00087 - (NSError*)errorByAddingUnderlyingError:(NSError*)underlyingError ;
00088 
00095 - (NSError*)errorByAddingUserInfoObject:(id)object
00096                                                                  forKey:(NSString*)key ;
00097 
00109 - (NSError*)errorByAddingMoreInfo:(id)object ;
00110 
00111 @end
